Comment: Many picked Trump because he's a hate monger. He's a racist, a sexist, and hates LGBT. And he's given the far right cover to hate freely like they have always had.  He won some of the middle because they liked what he had to say. But they made the mistake of trusting a man that couldnt explain how he would do any of the things he said. He sold a dream of bringing back 1960 and all these fantastic high-paying manufacturing jobs where a household can survive again on a single income and still buy a house, a car, a puppy, and a large family with the wife staying at home. That's the America dream they think they want to return to. But it's an America that isn't possible anymore.     Not those voters are going to learn a very difficult and hard lesson.

Comment: > Yeah, I'm sure that not allowing a primary,  there was a primary.  Biden won it.  Each state has it's own primary rules - there is literally NO WAY to do a 50 state primary 3 months before the general election.    The way it works is that you have a contested convention.  Abe Lincoln was no one's first choice, he didn't secure the nomination until the THIRD round of voting.  The Dems didn't have a contested convention because, with only 3 months until the general, the competition decided it was likely to crash and burn so they endorsed Harris instead of trying to run themselves.
